Validate and Format Annotation Data for Plotting

Source: R/AllGenerics.R
dot-check_an_viz.Rd

Helper function to validate and format annotation metadata used for plotting PCA or OPLS scores. Ensures that the input is a named list of up to three elements, and assigns default names if necessary.

Usage

.check_an_viz(an, obj)

Arguments

an

A list of annotation variables (e.g., group labels or sample metadata). If missing, defaults to the original response Y from the model object (for OPLS) or a placeholder for PCA.

obj

A PCA_metabom8 or OPLS_metabom8 object containing the model and optionally the annotation data.

Value

A cleaned and named list suitable for use with plotting functions (e.g., .viz_df_helper).

Details

If annotation names are missing or duplicated, default names are assigned. Only non-NULL entries are retained. A message is printed if more than three annotation variables are supplied.

Examples

# .check_an_viz(list(Group = c("A", "B")), model)
